message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.CC, cs.GT

Reasoning: The paper deals with combinatorial and geometric aspects of the simplex algorithm, which are typically studied in the sub-categories of Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM), Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS), Computational Geometry (cs.CG), Computational Complexity (cs.CC), and Game Theory (cs.GT). The concepts of reachmaps and niceness are related to the structure and properties of Unique Sink Orientations, which are combinatorial objects that arise in various areas of computer science, including optimization, graph theory, and game theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DM, cs.DS, and cs.CG, which focus on discrete structures, algorithms, and geometry. However, the paper also discusses the complexity of the simplex algorithm on certain classes of USO, which is a topic of interest in cs.CC, and mentions some connections to game theory, which is studied in cs.GT.
